intro: Pterostylis monticola, commonly known as the mountain greenhood, is an orchid native to eastern Australia. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, leafless stem that bears a single, elongated greenish-brown flower. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky outcrops. Its flowers have a distinctive hood-like structure with a spurred lip, typical of the Orchidaceae family. Pterostylis monticola is a small plant, usually reaching only a few centimeters in height, and is often found in cool, temperate regions.
